The rooms are huge

reviews.title: Lovely experience at the Scots Hotel.

reviews.text: The view terrific
reviews.title: Great hotel
I guess it's as good as it gets
reviews.text: The hotel is nice. Fairly large rooms, gorgeous grounds, attentive staff.

reviews.title: One of my favourites in Israel
reviews.text: Really, the only problem I had was with dinner. By the hotel's website, I was led to believe they had a great kitchen and was expecting a great meal at dinner. Had I known it was going to be a buffet, I wouldn't have bothered. A buffet? For $50 or 60/person? I was shocked. But then again, Israel's dining scene is definitely not up to par.
Book the hotel, skip the meal. There are plenty of other options in town.
reviews.title: Gorgeous but should have sampled a kibbutz

reviews.text: I recently spent a long week-end at the Scots, and this was one of my best hotel stays in Israel so far.
reviews.title: Great location for exploring Galilee, but a bit over-priced

likes.liked: — The food and the views of the Sea of Galilee
likes.disliked: — It did not feel like value for money

reviews.title: The Best for Boutique Lovers
reviews.text: The hotel consists of a few Ottoman renovated buildings and a new wing. The room was very large and comfortable, with a good flat-screen TV and a CD player. The bathroom was also large and had natural light (no separate shower, though). Next to the room there was a balcony overlooking the beautiful gardens and with a stunning view over the lake.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my second trip to the Scot's Hotel -- the previous being one year ago. This time, we stayed in one of the best rooms -- an antique lake view room. No complaints about the room -- huge bed, plasma tv, nice bathroom. The only thing I missed was a balcony opening directly off of our room. Instead we had to go into the hall and out onto the common balcony. That said, we were the only ones ever on it.
reviews.title: Second Trip, Still Fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we checked in, the duty manager came to greet us and took us up to our room. That was a nice touch. He also later gave us a private translation of his orientation to the wine cellar. The "tour" (not really a tour because it's one small room) was in Hebrew and it was a full house. After the locals left, we had our private translation, and the manager even made one of the staff go and get another bottle of wine for us so we could have another glass of wine. (Maybe this was after we mentioned it was my birthday. Actually, upon reading the previous review, I wish we had told them it was my birthday in advance. I would have loved some cake:-) )
reviews.title: Weekend at the Scots Hotel

likes.liked: — The beautiful gardens, public rooms and bedrooms
likes.disliked: — The bar was not very Scottish!

reviews.text: We peeked in on the evening entertainment -- a Simon and Garfunkel cover band. Again, it was a full house. I was actually very surprised by the numbers of people (Friday night). I didn't remember this from my previous stay. But, Saturday was much quieter as I believe there are fewer guests during the week. There tend to be more Israeli guests on the weekends (Thur, Fri) while the week has more foreign guests (per the manager).
reviews.title: Great Hotel/View/Cost

reviews.text: The breakfast was as I remembered it -- very delicious. They still have the amazing apple tart. We also enjoyed dinner one night (it's a bit pricey at 175 NIS, so we only did this one night).
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I noticed the hotel had a lot more staff this time compared to the last time I was there, and someone came to open the gate right away each time we entered the parking lot.
reviews.title: Upscale

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed with my wife at the Scots hotel to celebrate her birthday. It was a great experience and we loved every minute. Our stay was half board and dinner was real gourmet. The hotel is pricey but it is worth it.
reviews.title: The Scots is Great

reviews.text: I stayed at the Scots for three nights. The service was very good, the room was spacious, with a magnificent view of the lake. I booked the antique with lake view.
reviews.title: Beautiful place, and great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast had enough variety (i.e. different types of bread, fish, eggs....) and the people were always very courteous.
reviews.title: wonderful stay at the scots

likes.disliked: — only one computer for guests and 8$ per hour to use

reviews.title: Not worth the money
reviews.text: The only thing I didn't like was that internet was extra ($24 per day???) and I think a hotel of that category should probably include it in the rate and offer the service. But across the street there were three internet places for about US$1 per hour, so it wasn't really a big problem.
The location is excellent. I had a car and it was easy to get out of Tiberias and come back. Also it was close to a major street to go out for a walk, and some good restaurants and cafes for dinner.
reviews.title: Scots Hotel absolutely first class

likes.liked: — They were of a very high quality.
